paper_metadata.title: Effects of BRAC's Targeting the Ultra-poor Program in Bangladesh

program_information.program_name_citation: In 2002, BRAC developed and implemented an innovative anti-poverty program called "Challenging the Frontiers of Poverty Reduction: Targeting the Ultra-poor, Targeting Social Constraints" (henceforth TUP)
program_information.country_citation: It covered 100,000 ultra-poor households from 15 of the poorest districts of Bangladesh over a period of five years
program_information.target_population_citation: It focuses on developing human capital (health, education, and training) and physical capital (asset transfers) for poor women with the goal of helping them graduate to the standard micro-credit program of BRAC

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: With respect to livestock foot_17, tubewells and quilts/blankets, there is a strong positive impact on the ultra-poor group SB 1

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: This paper uses a two period panel data set (2002, 2005) to analyze the effects of the first phase of the TUP program on a set of household outcomes including income, food security, health, productive assets, household durable goods, and women empowerment
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: In particular, we use the difference-in-difference matching estimator (Heckman et. al., 1998, Todd, 2007) that combines a difference-in-difference approach with the matching technique to eliminate the time invariant unobserved heterogeneity
